summary: This bill, HR 1123, aims to abolish the United States Agency for International Development (USAID).  It prohibits the allocation of federal funds to USAID and rescinds the unobligated balance of existing funds.  Assets and liabilities of USAID are to be transferred to the Secretary of State. The bill was introduced in the House of Representatives by Ms. Greene and several other representatives and referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs and the Committee on Appropriations.
